Question 107) Medicines are routinely used by humans in order to decrease or, often, to cure possible health disorders. Antibiotics are groups of drugs inserted in the treatment of diseases caused by bacteria.
In the therapy of the mentioned diseases, some of these drugs act
A) activating the host's immune system.
B) interfering with the biochemical cascade of inflammation.
C) Removing toxins synthesized by bacteria.
D) Fighting host cells from bacteria.
E) damage specific structures of the bacterial cell.
